--- title: "Intro to the {tidyverse}" description: | a code-along workshop to learn data wrangling and visualization techniques using {tidyverse} functions author: - name: Samantha Csik url: https://samanthacsik.github.io/ orcid: 0000-0002-5300-3075 affiliation: R-Ladies Santa Barbara affiliation-url: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-santa-barbara/ - name: An Bui url: https://an-bui.com/ orcid: 0000-0002-9548-7776 affiliation: R-Ladies Santa Barbara affiliation-url: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-santa-barbara/ date: 2019-05-15 slug: csike2019tidyverse categories: [R-Ladies] image: infinity.gif --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](sam_an.jpg){fig-align='center' fig-alt='Two women, Sam and An, stand smiling in front of a projector screen with a GitHub repository on display.' width=75%} ::: ::: ::: {.gray-italic .center-text} An Bui and I getting ready to teach our very first R workshop to R-Ladies SB, hosted at NCEAS :::
::: {.center-text} [{{< fa file-alt title="A file with lines of text" >}} materials](https://rpubs.com/scsik/RladiesSB-intro-to-the-tidyverse){.btn role="button" target=_blank} [{{< fa brands github title="Octocat, the GitHub logo" >}} source code](https://github.com/samanthacsik/Intro-to-the-Tidyverse){.btn role="button" target=_blank} ::: # Abstract In this live-coding workshop, we teach useful functions for data tidying, wrangling and visualization using tidyverse packages & functions (e.g. `dplyr`, `tidyr`, `ggplot2`, `forcats`, etc.). This session is intended for R users at any level, whether it's your first time exploring the tidyverse or if you're refreshing your wrangling skills! # Audience My *very first time* (co)leading an R-based live-coding workshop(!) and the experience that got me hooked on teaching RStats/data science ðŸ’œ, given to [R-Ladies Santa Barbara](https://www.meetup.com/rladies-santa-barbara/events/260710376/).
